thread.title: Leonard Fournette's approaching milestones vs. South Carolina
thread.title_full: Leonard Fournette's approaching milestones vs. South Carolina | NOLA.com

author: Jim Kleinpeter, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Leonard Fournette's approaching milestones vs. South Carolina
text:
Leonard Fournette enters Saturday's game against South Carolina as the nation's leading rusher with 864 yards, and also leads with a 216 yards-per-game average and is tied for first with 11 rushing touchdowns.
Besides being the clear favorite to win the Heisman Trophy, he has surpassed numerous school records and even an SEC record.
That begs the question: What will Leonard achieve next? He's facing a pliant South Carolina defense that is allowing 170 yards rushing per game. That number is skewed by the UCF game in which the Gamecocks allowed 26. The average rushing yards in the other four against North Carolina, Kentucky, Georgia and Missouri is 206.
In five games, South Carolina has allowed four backs to gain at least 98 yards rushing.
Here are the milestones Fourneette can hit Saturday and keep scrolling for a look at his game-by game career stats and the national standings:
100 yards: Will mark the 6 th consecutive game with at least 100 yards. LSU record is nine by Charles Alexander (1976-78).
102 yards: Will put his career total at 2,000.
136 yards: Will give him 1,000 this season, the fastest player to that number (5 games) in LSU history.
171 yards: Will surpass his 13-game season total of 1,034 from last season.
200 yards: Will be his 4 th consecutive 200 yard game, breaking his own SEC record.
245 yards: Will give him a new career-high for a game.
251 yards: Will establish a single-game LSU rushing record, currently held by Alley Broussard vs. Ole Miss, 2004.
266 yards: Will put him into top 10 for LSU career rushing yards with 2,164, passing No. 10 Brad Davis (1972-74) at 2,163.
